alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; San Juan River Basin; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; Upper Gunnison River Valley; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 727 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 6 miles south of Marble to 14 miles northwest of Cedar Hill and moving southeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Montrose, Durango, Gunnison, Bayfield, Telluride, Pagosa Springs, Paonia, Mancos, Mountain Village, Ouray, Hotchkiss, Ridgway, Mount Crested Butte, Ignacio, Silverton, Crawford, Lake City, Rico, Pitkin and Sawpit. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado between mile markers 4 and 130. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 89 and 181, and between mile markers 191 and 192. U.S. Highway 84 in Colorado between mile markers 12 and 27. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 44 and 155. Colorado 62 between mile markers 1 and 23. Colorado 90 between mile markers 82 and 89. Colorado 92 between mile markers 16 and 73. Colorado 114 between mile markers 1 and 8. Colorado 133 between mile markers 1 and 35. Colorado 135 between mile markers 1 and 27. Colorado 140 between mile markers 5 and 23. Colorado 145 between mile markers 15 and 90. Colorado 149 between mile markers 44 and 117. Colorado 151 between mile markers 1 and 11, and between mile markers 17 and 33. Colorado 172 between mile markers 3 and 24. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
